verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>,
Hear <WH8085> diligently <WH8085> my speech <WH4405>; And let this be your consolations <WH8575>.
Suffer <WH5375> me <WH1696>, and I also will speak; And after <WH310> that I have spoken <WH1696>, mock on <WH3932>.
As for me <WH7879>, is my complaint to man <WH120>? And why should I <WH7307> not be impatient <WH7114>?
480 <WH6437> me <WH8074>, and be astonished, And lay <WH7760> your hand <WH3027> upon your mouth <WH6310>.
Even when I remember <WH2142> I am troubled <WH926>, And horror <WH6427> taketh hold on <WH270> my flesh <WH1320>.
Wherefore do the wicked <WH7563> live <WH2421>, Become old <WH6275>, yea <WH1396>, wax mighty in power <WH2428>?
Their seed <WH2233> is established <WH3559> with them in their sight <WH6440>, And their offspring <WH6631> before their eyes <WH5869>.
Their houses <WH1004> are safe <WH7965> from fear <WH6343>, Neither is the rod <WH7626> of God upon them <WH433>.
Their bull <WH7794> gendereth <WH5674>, and faileth <WH1602> not <WH6510>; Their cow calveth <WH6403>, and casteth not her calf <WH7921>.
They send forth <WH7971> their little ones <WH5759> like a flock <WH6629>, And their children <WH3206> dance <WH7540>.
They sing <WH5375> to the timbrel <WH8596> and harp <WH3658>, And rejoice <WH8055> at the sound <WH6963> of the pipe <WH5748>.
They spend <WH3615> their days <WH3117> in prosperity <WH2896>, And in a moment <WH7281> they go down <WH2865> to Sheol <WH7585>.
And they say <WH559> unto God <WH410>, Depart <WH5493> from us <WH2654>; For we desire not the knowledge <WH1847> of thy ways <WH1870>.
What is the Almighty <WH7706>, that we should serve <WH5647> him <WH3276>? And what profit should we have <WH6293>, if we pray unto him?
Lo <WH2898>, their prosperity is not in their hand <WH3027>: The counsel <WH6098> of the wicked <WH7563> is far from me <WH7368>.

How oft is it that the lamp <WH5216> of the wicked <WH7563> is put out <WH1846>? That their calamity <WH343> cometh <WH935> upon them <WH2505>? That God distributeth sorrows <WH2256> in his anger <WH639>?
That they are as stubble <WH8401> before <WH6440> the wind <WH7307>, And as chaff <WH4671> that the storm <WH5492> carrieth away <WH1589>?
Ye say <WH433>, God layeth up <WH6845> his iniquity <WH205> for his children <WH1121>. Let him recompense <WH7999> it unto himself <WH3045>, that he may know it:
Let his own eyes <WH5869> see <WH7200> his destruction <WH3589>, And let him drink <WH8354> of the wrath <WH2534> of the Almighty <WH7706>.
For what careth <WH2656> he for his house <WH1004> after <WH310> him <WH4557>, When the number of his months <WH2320> is cut off <WH2686>?
Shall any teach <WH3925> God <WH410> knowledge <WH1847>, Seeing he judgeth <WH8199> those that are high <WH7311>?
One dieth <WH4191> in his full <WH8537> strength <WH6106>, Being wholly at ease <WH7946> and quiet <WH7961>:
His pails <WH5845> are full <WH4390> of milk <WH2461>, And the marrow <WH4221> of his bones <WH6106> is moistened <WH8248>.
And another dieth <WH4191> in bitterness <WH4751> of soul <WH5315>, And never tasteth <WH398> of good <WH2896>.
They lie down <WH7901> alike <WH3162> in the dust <WH6083>, And the worm <WH7415> covereth them <WH3680>.
Behold <WH3045>, I know your thoughts <WH4284>, And the devices <WH4209> wherewith ye would wrong me <WH2554>.
For ye say <WH559>, Where is the house <WH1004> of the prince <WH5081>? And where is the tent <WH4908> wherein the wicked <WH7563> dwelt <WH4908>?
Have ye not asked <WH7592> wayfaring <WH1870> men <WH5674>? And do ye not know <WH5234> their evidences <WH226>,
That the evil <WH7451> man is reserved <WH2820> to the day <WH3117> of calamity <WH343>? That they are led forth <WH2986> to the day <WH3117> of wrath <WH5678>?
Who shall declare <WH5046> his way <WH1870> to his face <WH6440>? And who shall repay <WH7999> him what he hath done <WH6213>?
Yet shall he be borne <WH2986> to the grave <WH6913>, And men shall keep watch <WH8245> over the tomb <WH1430>.
The clods <WH7263> of the valley <WH5158> shall be sweet <WH4985> unto him <WH120>, And all men shall draw <WH4900> after <WH310> him <WH4557>, As there were innumerable before him <WH6440>.
How then comfort <WH5162> ye me in vain <WH1892>, Seeing in your answers <WH8666> there remaineth <WH7604> only falsehood <WH4604>?
